parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Clutch Bracket Failure due to Metal Fatigue
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the clutch bracket can cause the clutch to become inoperative, leading to accidents or other problems.
symptoms: The clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
the clutch pedal sticks to the floor
the clutch pedal does not return to its normal position
the clutch pedal has a delayed return to its normal position
the clutch pedal has a sudden loss of pressure
the vehicle is unable to shift into gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the concentric slave cylinder can cause the clutch pedal to stick to the floor, making it difficult or impossible to shift gears, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
the clutch pedal sticks to the floor
the clutch pedal does not return to its normal position
the clutch pedal has a delayed return to its normal position
the clutch pedal has a sudden loss of pressure
the vehicle is unable to shift into gear.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Driveshaft CV Joint Failure due to Poor Design
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the driveshaft CV joint can cause noise, vibration, and loss of power, leading to accidents or other problems.
symptoms: Noise coming from the transmission
vibration while driving
loss of power
difficulty shifting gears.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Loose or broken motor mounts can cause excessive engine vibration, leading to premature wear on engine components, belts, and hoses, and potentially causing damage to the engine or other components.
symptoms: Excessive engine vibration
noise
or movement
rough idling
or difficulty starting the engine.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A failed drive belt can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage, and potentially causing the engine to stall or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: Squealing or chirping noise from the engine
engine overheating
loss of power steering or air conditioning
or engine stalling.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Loose or broken exhaust bolts can cause the exhaust system to leak, leading to decreased engine performance, reduced fuel efficiency, and potentially causing carbon monoxide to enter the vehicle.
symptoms: Loud rattling or clunking noise from the exhaust system
decreased engine performance
or a strong odor of exhaust fumes inside the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the idler pulley can cause the serpentine belt to malfunction, leading to overheating of the engine, loss of power steering, and failure of the alternator, which can result in a breakdown or accident.
symptoms: The serpentine belt is noisy or squealing
the engine is overheating
the power steering is malfunctioning
the alternator is not charging
the vehicle is experiencing a loss of power.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Tread Separation on Original Equipment Tires
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Tread separation on the original equipment tires can lead to loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potential injuries or fatalities, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: Unusual noises
such as a loud thumping or exhaust-like sound
followed by a loss of tire pressure
vibration
or a sudden pull to one side.
